title: Radcliffe 'murder': Man and woman charged over death of baby girl
text:

A man and a woman have been charged following the alleged murder of a one-year-old baby girl.

The child was found injured at an address in Radcliffe, Greater Manchester, just after 2.25pm on Wednesday, say police.

She was rushed to hospital, where she died "despite best efforts of specialist doctors," according to Greater Manchester Police.

Two suspects were arrested following the baby girl's death.

Police announced on Saturday that Jamie Chadwick, 21, of Radcliffe, has been charged with murder.

Chelsea Crilly, 19, of Atherton, has been charged with causing or allowing the death or serious harm of a child, the force added.

(Image: Manchester Evening News)

Both have been remanded in custody.

They are scheduled to appear before Manchester & Salford Magistrates’ Court on Saturday.

Specialist officers are assisting family members to help them through "this dreadful time", said police.

(Image: Manchester Evening News)

A police spokesperson said: "Shortly after 2.25pm on Wednesday 16 October 2019 police were called to reports that a one-year-old girl was injured at a property on Cross Lane.

"Emergency services attended and the girl was taken to hospital where she sadly died despite best efforts of specialist doctors."

Previously, Superintendent Chris Bridge, of GMP’s Wigan District, said: “This is a truly devastating incident that has led to a one-year-old girl losing her life.

"Specially trained police officers are with the family and are doing everything they can to support them through this dreadful time.

“A 21-year-old man and a 19-year-old woman have now been arrested and we are working hard to understand what course of events led to the death of an innocent baby girl.”
description: The one-year-old girl died after she was found injured at an address in Radcliffe, Greater Manchester, say police
